main event: A military aircraft spotted a brilliant, disc-shaped object over the Atlantic Ocean that was in flight and stationary.
interesting points: The object was observed for 23 seconds, traveling from east to west at an approximate speed of 19,200 feet per second (2,232 mph).
Two separate military aircraft observed the object, one at an altitude of 21,000 feet and the other at an unknown altitude.
The weather conditions at the time of the sighting were clear, with no cloud cover or thunderstorms.
The report concludes that there was insufficient data to evaluate the nature of the observed object.
The report includes detailed weather data, including wind speeds and directions at various altitudes.
